cz.muni.fi.virtualtoolmanager.pubapi.managers

Interface VirtualMachineManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VirtualMachineManagerImpl

    public interface VirtualMachineManager
    Interface that declare what method the implementation of the virtual machine manager should provide.
    By implementing the declared methods, it should be possible to remotely control one virtual machine, e.g. virtual machine starting operation.
    See Also:
    VirtualMachine, FrontEndType, PortRule

    • Method Detail

      • startVM

        void startVM(VirtualMachine virtualMachine,
             FrontEndType frontEndType)
        Method that the given virtual machine starts in the mode specified by the given front-end type.
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents the virtual machine which is going to be started
        frontEndType - represents the front-end type used for the virtual machine

      • shutDownVM

        void shutDownVM(VirtualMachine virtualMachine)
        Method that the given virtual machine shuts down.
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents the virtual machine which is going to be shut down

      • addPortRule

        void addPortRule(VirtualMachine virtualMachine,
                 PortRule portRule)
        Method that ensures the addition of a new port-forwarding rule to a single virtual machine.

        To use the port-forwarding rules the virtual machine must be attached to the NAT network adapter.

        The name of a port rule which should be added to a particular virtual machine must be unique on that virtual machine accross the all its existing port-forwarding rules. Also host port number can be used only with a one port-forwarding rule on a single virtual machine.

        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents the virtual machine to which the new port-forwarding rule will be added
        portRule - represents the port rule, which should be added to the virtual machine

      • deletePortRule

        void deletePortRule(VirtualMachine virtualMachine,
                    PortRule portRule)
        Method that deletes a particular port-forwarding rule from a particular virtual machine.
        To ensure the correct deletion of the specified port rule it is necessary the port rule really exists for the virtual machine.
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents a particular virtual machine from which the specified port-forwarding rule should be deleted
        portRule - represents the port rule which will be deleted from a particular virtual machine

      • deleteAllPortRules

        void deleteAllPortRules(VirtualMachine virtualMachine)
        Method that deletes all existing port-forwarding rules of a particular virtual machine.
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents the virtual machine whose all port rules will be deleted

      • getPortRules

        java.util.List<PortRule> getPortRules(VirtualMachine virtualMachine)
        Method that retrieves all existing port rules from a particular virtual machine.
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents the virtual machine from which should be retrieved all its port rules
        Returns:
        list of existing port rules of a particular virtual machine

      • getVMState

        java.lang.String getVMState(VirtualMachine virtualMachine)
        Method that gets the actual state of a particular virtual machine.
        Parameters:
        virtualMachine - represents the virtual machine whose state should be got
        Returns:
        virtual machine state as string
